block.p: National League METS -- Optioned RHP Eric Cammack to Norfolk of the International League. Recalled LHP Rich Rodriguez from Norfolk.

Women's National Basketball Association WNBA -- Fined Utah coach Fred Williams $1,500 for verbally abusing the referees and failing to leave the court in a timely manner following his ejection in a game against Detroit July 7.
National League METS -- Optioned RHP Eric Cammack to Norfolk of the International League. Recalled LHP Rich Rodriguez from Norfolk.

Women's National Basketball Association WNBA -- Fined Utah coach Fred Williams $1,500 for verbally abusing the referees and failing to leave the court in a timely manner following his ejection in a game against Detroit July 7.

National Football League BUFFALO BILLS -- Signed WR Avion Black to a three-year contract. CLEVELAND BROWNS -- Agreed to terms with DE Eric Chandler, DB Rashidi Barnes, OL Manuia Savea and OL Brad Bedell, on four-year contracts. GREEN BAY PACKERS -- Signed LB Eugene McCaslin to a multiyear contract. Placed QB Ben Sankey on waivers. KANSAS CITY CHIEFS -- Agreed to terms with TE Rickey Brady on a two-year contract. JETS -- Signed DE Shaun Ellis and LB John Abraham to five-year contracts. SAN FRANCISCO 49ERS -- Announced that S Tim McDonald has retired. TENNESSEE TITANS -- Signed RB Mike Green. WASHINGTON REDSKINS -- Signed CB Lloyd Harrison to a four-year contract.

National Hockey League ATLANTA THRASHERS -- Acquired F-D Steve Staios from the New Jersey Devils for future considerations. CAROLINA HURRICANES -- Signed F Ian McNeil to a multiyear contract. MINNESOTA WILD -- Named Chris Hansen president and Jim Ibister vice president of the St. Paul Arena Company. NEW YORK RANGERS -- Signed D Vladimir Malakhov to a four-year contract plus an option year.

NASCAR -- Fined crew chief Jimmy Fenning $25,000 for having his car under the required height and crew chief Gary DeHart $7,000 for improperly attaching added weight to his car for the thatlook.com 300 held on July 9.
Major League Soccer NEW ENGLAND REVOLUTION -- Signed F Jose Luis Morales.

ALABAMA-BIRMINGHAM -- Announced the retirement of Gene Bartow, athletic director. BROWN -- Announced the resignation of Peter Lasagna, men's lacrosse coach, so he can take the same position at Bates. IOWA -- Named Garland O'Keefe women's swimming coach. NORTH CAROLINA -- Named Todd Cavallaro men's assistant lacrosse coach and Nunzio Esposto diving coach. NORTHERN KENTUCKY -- Announced the retirement of Mary Biermann, women's volleyball coach, effective at the end of the 2000 season. OKLAHOMA STATE -- Named Tanya Ray women's assistant basketball coach. PORTLAND -- Named Lemont Daniels and Bob Lowe men's assistant basketball coaches. PROVIDENCE -- Named Phil Seymore men's assistant basketball coach. TEMPLE -- Named Ervin Monier women's assistant basketball coach. VILLANOVA -- Named Vince Nicastro athletic director. VIRGINIA TECH -- Named Lisa Hart women's tennis coach. WAKE FOREST -- Named Larry Leonard women's assistant basketball coach.
